{"id":1518298061,"question_id":3291,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"3 weeks, 6 days","timestamp":1737657247,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"87 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1518298061/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Find if Array Can Be Sorted","memory":"17.9 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def canSortArray(self, nums: List[int]) -> bool:\n        n=len(nums)\n\n        values=nums.copy()\n\n        for i in range(n):\n\n            for j in range(n-i-1):\n\n                if values[j]<=values[j+1]:\n                    continue\n\n                else:\n                    if bin(values[j]).count(\"1\")==bin(values[j+1]).count(\"1\"):\n                        values[j],values[j+1]=values[j+1],values[j]\n\n                    else:\n                        return False\n\n        return True","compare_result":"","title_slug":"find-if-array-can-be-sorted","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
